name: Land of Crops and Aid
title: Highest Permanent Cropland and Aid Dependency
description: In 2022, Tuvalu had 60% of its land dedicated to permanent cropland, the highest in the world. Additionally, the country received net ODA amounting to 79.85% of its GNI and 110.18% of its imports, highlighting its significant reliance on foreign aid.

name: Aid Per Capita Champs
title: Highest Net ODA Received Per Capita
description: Tuvalu received $6,361.09 per capita in net ODA in 2022, the highest globally, underscoring its heavy reliance on international assistance for development.

name: Tiny Economy, Big Imports
title: High Import Dependency
description: In 2022, Tuvalu's imports of goods and services reached $57.4 million, while exports were only $2.2 million, highlighting a significant trade imbalance.

name: Small but Mighty GDP
title: Modest Economic Output
description: Tuvalu's GDP in 2023 was $62.3 million, reflecting its status as one of the smallest economies globally.

name: Minimal Emissions, Maximum Impact
title: Low Industrial Emissions
description: In 2023, Tuvalu's nitrous oxide emissions from industrial processes were just 0.0001 Mt CO2e, showcasing its minimal industrial footprint.

name: Water Woes
title: Limited Urban Water Access
description: Only 10.47% of Tuvalu's urban population had access to safely managed drinking water services in 2022, indicating a critical infrastructure challenge.

name: Small Population, Big Heart
title: Tiny Population
description: With a total population of 9,816 in 2023, Tuvalu is one of the least populated countries in the world.

name: Education Enthusiasts
title: High Secondary School Enrollment
description: In 2023, Tuvalu had 1,252 pupils enrolled in secondary education, reflecting a strong commitment to education despite its small size.

name: Birds of a Feather
title: Minimal Threatened Bird Species
description: As of 2018, Tuvalu had only one bird species classified as threatened, highlighting its relatively healthy avian biodiversity.
